original: PETERSEN, Wilhelm Henning, Ingenjör, Västerås, f Vinslöv, Krst l, 23/9 84 av lantbr K L P o Anna Lundqvister, gm Eliza Petersson. Sölvesborgs allm lärov, Tekn elem.sk Malmö, privatstud, prakt Engl 2 år. Anst ASEA V.ås sed. 04; medhj i provrum, förest app.provr; chef reläbyrån 19—39; konsult f app.konstr sed. 39. Styr.led El klbn V.ås 14— 18, ordf i Ludvika skyttef 22—26, Styr.led i V.ås landst.frn 28—38, ordf Skidfrämj lokal-komm V.ås 32—40, ordf i V.ås luftsk.frn arb.-utskott sed. 38. Led Sv Teknfrn. Frim. Fd Istkapt. IVA:s m GM 34, Sv landst.frn cen-tralfrb SM, Västmanl landst.frb GM, Riks-luftsk.frb ftjt s, PatrstGM, idr.m g, skyttem g, lst.idr.m g, skidl.m g. Hobbies: Konstr.-arb, militär litteratur, fjällvandring, skidåkning, Skytte.
translated: PETERSEN, Wilhelm Henning, Engineer, Västerås, born in Vinslöv, christened on September 23, 1884, son of farmer K L P and Anna Lundqvist, married to Eliza Petersson. Attended Sölvesborg public school, Technical elementary school in Malmö, private studies, practical training in England for 2 years. Employed at ASEA Västerås since 1904; assistant in testing room, assistant supervisor of testing department; head of relay office from 1919 to 1939; consultant for testing department since 1939. Board member of the Electricity Club Västerås from 1914 to 1918, chairman of the Ludvika shooting association from 1922 to 1926, board member of the Västerås county council from 1928 to 1938, chairman of the Västerås ski promotion local committee from 1932 to 1940, chairman of the Västerås air defense committee from 1938. Member of the Swedish Engineers Association. Freemason. Former First Lieutenant in the Swedish Army. Awarded the Grand Master's Medal by the Royal Swedish Academy of Engineering Sciences in 1934, Gold Medal by the Central Workers' Gymnastics and Sports Federation, Gold Medal by the Västmanland County Gymnastics Federation, Silver Medal by the National Air Defense Federation, Patriotic Gold Medal, sports medals in shooting, track and field, skiing. Hobbies: Engineering work, military literature, mountain hiking, skiing, shooting.

structured.description: Engineer, Freemason, Former First Lieutenant in the Swedish Army
